intro: Dasycoleum sayeri, commonly known as the Sayer's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy and rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs. Dasycoleum sayeri is adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
